page.title: 12Morlais Castle.
page.content: Within the block to the north of Merthyr Tydfil rises a hill which dominates views to the south,west, east and north.This was the best site for a castle for miles around.We can only look over the ruins of the castle today.Traces of a dry moat running from the west around to the east are still evident and so is the beautiful arched architecture of the crypt.It is quite a handsome room whose stone ceiling is supported by twelve elegant pointed arches resting on a twelve sided central pillar. Some people say that the castle was never completed but some say there has been a castle on this site long before 1265 when Gilbert De Clare erected a strong outpost castle on Morlais Hill. We can still find the shaped coping stones and corbels of towers and walls.
